instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message: [COLOR=#333333][FONT=Verdana][SIZE=13px]hey guys i was wondering if anyone could help me, i have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b no water damge, i have read from several articals that the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> chip goes bad on this randomly. so i changed the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> chip and i get a green light now, but when i short the power button pads nothing happens no fan spin no chime nothing, any help would be appricated, can send a tip with bitcoin.[/SIZE][/FONT][/COLOR]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message:
These power on by themselves without a battery. 
First take measurements, what voltage is on L7030? Should be 12.6V, if not check <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>/52 and <RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>/22 also check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message:
thanks for the reply duke. hope this helps

L7030
V 12.61

<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> 0.791
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> 0.4

<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> 10.1
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> 10.4

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> 224.8

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> should be 20ohm and if I remember correctly if that is fucked <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is also fucked.. which is baffling since you have 12,6V

<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> should be 2.2ohm
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> should be 0ohm... these two are for current sensing and should give proper readings.

<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR> - <RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> seem good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message:
hey george

i replaced the <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>, now it read 20 ohm, also wanted to note that <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> was reading 0.7 ohm i replaced that also now it reads 2.2, any more suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message: Should work now. Are you using an original known 85W charger, MUST be 85W or board will not power on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message: wow i just realized my charger is 60 watts

threads.message: and there it is, it chimed and booted but i have this pinkish tint on lcd now any ideas? bad gpu?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message: Yes that is a GPU issue. If the board looks somewhat clean and unmolested I would take this to Apple under the exchange program and not mess with it myself.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message: Yes, check apple support website on active repair programs. It must not be visibly fucked up of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B Green light no power
threads.message:
Hello. I have been working on an issue very much like this one. Originally I had no power, no lights at all.
I Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>  now I get a green light but no boot, fans etc.
I've been back and forth so many times that I really am completely lost now. It 'seems" like I have power every where that I should.
Would you please assist me?

I followed the info in the beginning of this post and these are the results I get..

L7030
pin 1  12.65V
pin 2  12.65V
pin 3  0v

<RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>  12.65v
<RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR>  12.65v
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>  16.09v
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR>  16.09v

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>  16.42
